title: Peter Whittle (mathematician)
summary: Peter Whittle (27 February 1927[4] â€“ 10 August 2021[5]) was a mathematician and statistician from New Zealand, working in the fields of stochastic nets, optimal control, time series analysis, stochastic optimisation and stochastic dynamics. From 1967 to 1994, he was the Churchill Professor of Mathematics for Operational Research at the University of Cambridge.[6]
